title: Self-Sovereign Identity in Practice
description: Building wallet-based identity systems that put users in control
longDescription:
In this conversation, we explore the practical challenges of implementing self-sovereign identity systems. John shares insights from building production-grade wallet solutions that balance user sovereignty with enterprise requirements.

We discuss the technical architecture, UX challenges, and regulatory landscape shaping the future of digital identity.
keyTakeaways: User sovereignty doesn't mean abandoning all centralized services
The biggest challenge is UX, not technology
Regulatory clarity is emerging faster than expected

title: The Future of Product Passports
description: How digital product passports will transform supply chains and sustainability
longDescription: Jane Smith discusses the EU's Digital Product Passport regulations and their global impact. We explore how DPPs will create transparency across supply chains and enable a circular economy.
keyTakeaways: DPPs will be mandatory in EU by 2027 for many product categories
Interoperability is the key technical challenge
First movers will gain competitive advantage

title: Designing for Manufacturing
description: Bringing design thinking to factory floors and manufacturing operations
longDescription: Mike shares lessons from a decade designing enterprise software for manufacturing. We discuss the unique challenges of designing for industrial environments and the importance of understanding operational constraints.
keyTakeaways: Factory workers are power users who need efficient, not pretty, interfaces
Context switching costs are higher in manufacturing than office work
Design systems must accommodate extreme customization
